alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 10:36PM EST until January 11 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bradford and Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EST, rain and snowmelt is causing minor flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chemung, Sayre, Waverly, Athens, Towanda, Canton, Montrose, Troy, Wyalusing, Rush, Ridgebury, Wysox, Susquehanna Depot, Ulster, Litchfield, Hallstead, North Towanda, Springfield, South Waverly and Windham. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
